greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the sum of reciprocals of the smallest primes > 2^k for k >= 0.
comment: If q(k) = A014210(k) is the smallest prime > 2^k, then 2^k < q(k), so Sum_{k>=0} 1/q(k) < Sum_{k>=0} 1/2^k = 2; hence, the sum of the reciprocals of these primes q(k) form a convergent series.
reference: J.-M. De Koninck & A. Mercier, 1001 Problèmes en Théorie Classique des Nombres, Problème 615 pp. 82 and 279, Ellipses, Paris, 2004. Warning : gives Sum_{k>=1} 1/A104080(k) = 0.7404...
mathematica: ndigits = 90; RealDigits[Sum[1/NextPrime[2^k], {k, 0, ndigits/Log10[2] + 1}], 10, ndigits][[1]] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Oct 29 2020 *)
results.author: _Bernard Schott_, Oct 29 2020
